alert.note: Alert for Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 24 at 10:53PM CDT until June 24 at 11:30PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... East central Rock Island County in northwestern Illinois... Southern Whiteside County in northwestern Illinois... Northern Henry County in northwestern Illinois... Northwestern Bureau County in north central Illinois... Southeastern Scott County in east central Iowa... * Until 1130 PM CDT. * At 1051 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Pleasant Valley, or near Bettendorf, moving east at 45 mph. At 1040 PM CDT, there was a measured gust of 70 mph at the Davenport airport. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Davenport, Moline, Rock Island, Bettendorf, East Moline, Silvis, Geneseo, Colona, Le Claire, Coal Valley, Hampton, Port Byron, Atkinson, Rapids City, Sheffield, Annawan, Riverdale, Hooppole, Cleveland and Deer Grove. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in the Quad Cities. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
